revised_title: Swimming Mechanisms and Efficiency in Marine and Freshwater Turtles
tldr: This study compares the swimming mechanisms of marine green turtles and freshwater chelonians, focusing on the advantages of the streamlined form and unique flipper action of marine turtles. The research finds that green turtles can generate twice the propulsive force and swim six times faster than Caspian terrapins, due to their efficient swimming action and streamlined shape. The swimming performance of young green turtles is similar in efficiency to that of streamlined fish like mackerel.
